intro: Limniris × thompsonii, commonly known as the Thompson's limniris, is a hybrid plant that belongs to the family Poaceae, or grass family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stalks and narrow, linear leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. It is typically found in wet or moist environments such as marshes and along stream banks. Due to its hybrid nature, Limniris × thompsonii exhibits a range of morphological variations depending on its parent species.
